author: {'steamid': '76561197999559583', 'num_games_owned': 413, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 4442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4442, 'last_played': 86400}
review:
I recommend this game, because it's extremely fun. There is however, a surprisingly steep learning curve (to be good). The multiplayer leveling system is simliar to Call of Duty 4. 

There are a few official noob friendly servers, and once you hit the max level you should be good enough to play with the servers that have more skilled players. Still, once you master the gameplay, you'll be hooked. Plane Ball is the best!

author: {'steamid': '76561198024978855', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2062, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1093, 'last_played': 1426898077}
review: Altitude, a plane combat game, is easy to learn and hard to master. Different types of planes, weapon and tools loadouts, leveling, in-game power ups and different types of gameplay ensures that you will have a whole lot of fun with this really nicely priced game. Plays great with gamepad and keyboard too. Be sure not to miss it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972678696', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1042, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1042, 'last_played': 86400}
review: Fun plane physics, good unlockables and nothing feels too overpowered. Fun game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997388613', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5299, 'last_played': 1398935109}
review:
Meiner Meinung nach eines der besten Indie-Games. Auf den ersten Blick mag Altitude vielleicht eintönig und veraltet wirken, aber ich kann es nur jedem empfehlen, das Spiel auszuprobieren. Die Balance ist wirklich sehr ausgewogen und mit den Modifikationen für jedes Flugzeug gibt es zahllose Varianten und Spielstrategien zum ausprobieren. 
Die Grafik überzeugt durch ihre Schlichtheit und tut dem Spielspaß keinen Abbruch. Im Gegenteil; durch die geringen Hardwareanforderungen des Spiels ist man innerhalb von Sekunden im Gefecht, was zusätzlich durch die sehr gute Serverfindung unterstützt wird.
Dadurch, dass man mit der Zeit im Level aufsteigt und dadurch neue Flieger und Modifikationen freischaltet, bleibt auch über lange Zeit die Motivation erhalten!
Wer unsicher sein sollte, kann sich auch anhand der Demo von den Stärken des Spiels überzeugen!

review: This is the second game I ever got on Steam and I loved it. It is proof that a game does not have to have good graphics to be fun.  It's little football mode doesn't make sense for a plane fighting game, but who cares! It's fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561197998996499', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2826, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2826, 'last_played': 1348297200}
review:
This is a must have for anyone that's ever liked fast, frenetic and gratifying multiplayer games. It's the indie version of Team Fortress 2 and I'm sure that if you're on Steam, you already own and love Team Fortress 2 so this is really a no brainer.

Altitude is an extremely fun, greatly addicting and easy to play aerial combat game and I recommend it to anyone and their girlfriends.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984448111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 86400}

author: {'steamid': '76561197981353644', 'num_games_owned': 1406, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 831, 'last_played': 1358582400}
review:
"Awesome game.

A good learning curve, not too steep. Once you get the idea, it becomes fun! The graphics are simple, but sexy. There are 5 classes, and tons of gamemodes. It works great on even the worst computers! 

Buy it, for 10 bucks, you can't go wrong."

I wrote this in 2010.

As of now the community is mostly dead, but I still think its a fantastic game.
Don't buy for $10, but if it goes on sale do consider it.  An Altitude 2 would be fantastic, sadly I doubt it will end up happening.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962278826', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 4506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4499, 'last_played': 1527205692}
review:
More fun than it has any right to be. The real triumph of this game is not the action-filled multiplayer battles or the balanced classes, it is the fact that the developers have figured out how to inject heroin into photons. I find myself waking up in the middle of the night in a cold sweat, my hands twitching to play just one more round of Altitude. 

Then, the 3-headed bears come.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974877784', 'num_games_owned': 1767, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1029, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 871, 'last_played': 1499343453}
review: This is one of the jewels of modern indie multiplayer - a cute, slick, difficult little game with a good community and an involved developer. Player-hosted servers, custom maps, meaningful achievements, and a fair leveling system keep it active even late at night. Control is very tight, sound is good; and as an odd hybrid of SubSpace without brakes and Soldat with wall damage, there is really nothing quite like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961853591', 'num_games_owned': 80, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5344, 'last_played': 1626397832}
review:
Absolutely incredible indie game! With fast-paced, in-your-face action, Altitude keeps you on the edge of your seat. As you play, unlock a collection of five planes, along with an array of buffs, letting you customize your fighter to your personal style of play (via a perk system like Modern Warfare's). Pack in several game modes as well as a sizable collection of maps, and this indie title gives you variety that'll keep you coming back for more! 

Reminiscent of an old-school DOS game I used to play on my 386, Altitude brings back memories. The keyboard controls are as simple as in the good ol' days, but you can also control your plane entirely with the mouse. Instead of the black-and-white pixels of my memories, the graphics are simple, sleek, crisp, and stylized like Team Fortress 2's, giving Altitude a longer future than games that aim for ultra-realism. Games don't need much realism; they need the simple elegance that Altitude has, with it's solid gameplay and balanced variety.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986187850', 'num_games_owned': 2239, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1345359600}

author: {'steamid': '76561198003061835', 'num_games_owned': 482, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 515, 'last_played': 86400}
review: This is a great arcade game. It has a lot of action in it and certain gamemodes. There are items different kind of guns and planes, and you level up in it to unlock more weapons for your ship. It's a pretty basic arcade game you play shoot down other planes and try not to die. 7 / 10

author: {'steamid': '76561197970819060', 'num_games_owned': 1437, 'num_reviews': 313, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 86400}
review:
There's a lot of customization and unlockable crap to make your plane unique & build situational loadouts. However the biggest problem (and the reason I stopped playing) is the unlocks get more powerful as you level up so that higher leveled players can just stomp all over new players. Maybe if this were a PvE RPG setting that would be OK however this has been advertised as a 2D TF2 and results in "noobs only" servers and "big kid" servers to divide up the rape.

If you have a group of friends to play with this could be great fun. On it's own it has little replay value unless you want to grind through the kiddie pool in order to play the "real" game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995447720', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 48456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48454, 'last_played': 1548821766}
review:
Maybe a niche thing, but it has solid gameplay, amusing physics, and a surprisingly cool community. Endlessly replayable if you ask me. 

As far as I can tell, the demo is the full game just with a cutoff in leveling (thus limiting plane and loadout selection), but you still get to play online and stuff.
